Achievements

  • Establishment of AITWA's well equipped NATIONAL SECRETARIAT run by a competent team of personnel working under highly experienced Secretary General. Publication of AITWA's mouth piece PARIVAHAN PRAGATI as the foremost journal of India Road Transport Sector.
  • Launch of JAGRATI RATH, Mobile Aids Awareness vehicle to tour the length and breath of the country, which was flagged off by the then Vice President of India his excellency BHAIRO SINGH SHEKHINAT in the year 2007.
  • Participation by SHRI. OP AGARWAL THEN CHAIRMAN OF AITWA in high power committee constituted by the union government to formulate the provisions of Service Tax Law and securing 75% ABATEMENT OF SERVICE TAX payable by the transporters.
  • Providing active relief and contribution to PM Relief Fund in times of NATURAL DISASTER IN ANDHRA PRADESH. Holding of SEMINARS AND WORKSHOPS from time to time for the benefit of Road Transport fraternity from time to time celebration. 6 Observance of "PARIVAHAN DIWAS" in the month of January and organizing National conventions on this day from time to time.
  • Recognition as the representative body of Indian Transport Industry by IRU, an INTERNATIONAL BODY OF WORLD-WIDE ROAD TRANSPORT SECTOR under the ageis of United Nation (UNO) body its member.
  • ORGANISING INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE OF ROAD TRANSPORT INDUSTRY IN THE YEAR 2008 AT NEW DELHI ON THE THEME OF "LOGISTICS VISION-2008" IN COLLABORATION WITH INTERNATIONAL ROAD UNION (IRU) AND THE MINISTRY OF ROAD TRANSPORT AND HIGHWAYS (MORTH).
  • REPRESENTING INDIA AT THE ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING CUM CONFERENCE OF INTERNATIONAL ROAD UNION (IRU) AT ISTANBUL, TURKEY AND TBLISI, GEORGIA. Organising Eye check up (Chalak Drishti), DRIVERS HEALTH CHECK UP Aids awareness and Blood Donation camps from time to time.
  • REPRESENTATION AT NHAI'S TOLL COMMITTEES BY HONOURANLE SHRI. OP AGARWAL
  • Presentations by AITWA in the meetings of PLANNING COMMISSION.
  • Representation before the PARLIAMENTARY STANDING COMMITTEE on provisions of Carriers Act, 2007.
  • Participating in Annual "ROAD SAFETY WEEK" organised by MORTH as the main stakeholders.
